articles.author: Tom Hals
articles.description: Jury selection kicked off in a criminal case against Hunter Biden, a historic prosecution that could further influence the 2024 presidential election four days after Biden's rivalDonald Trump became the first former U.S. president to be convicted.
articles.title: Jury selection begins in Hunter Biden's criminal trial

articles.author: Kylie Madry, Valentine Hilaire
articles.description: Claudia Sheinbaum, a Nobel Prize-winning climate scientist, will become Mexico's first female president after winning a landslide election victory and promising to continue the work of her mentor and outgoing leader Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.
articles.title: Claudia Sheinbaum claims sweeping mandate to become Mexico's first female president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said on Monday there was no place for threats of violence or instability after last week's election cost his African National Congress (ANC) party its majority for the first time.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa says violence has no place after election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China held its stance on three disputed islands in the Gulf on Monday despite Tehran's anger at Beijing for describing the Iran-controlled islands as a matter to be resolved with the United Arab Emirates.
articles.title: China maintains stance on disputed Gulf islands despite Iran's anger

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: Nigel Farage, who helped champion Britain's departure from the European Union, said on Monday he would stand as a candidate in next month's election and will lead the right-wing Reform Party in a major blow to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.
articles.title: In blow to PM, Brexit champion Nigel Farage to stand in UK election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The armed Lebanese group Hezbollah said on Monday it had launched a squadron of drones towards the headquarters of the Israeli military's Galilee formation.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah launches drones squadron towards Israeli military targets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Pakistan has overturned the prison sentence of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan on Monday in a case pertaining to the leaking of state secrets, local broadcaster ARY news and his lawyer said.
articles.title: Pakistan court suspends former PM Imran Khan's sentence in state secrets case - ARY News

articles.author: Mohammed Salem
articles.description: After another airstrike pulverised Gaza, the two al-Breim sisters realised their mother Amira was missing and rushed to the scene, crying out her name and frantically sifting through rubble for any sign of her.
articles.title: Palestinian sisters cry out for missing mother after Gaza airstrike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A volcano in central Philippines erupted on Monday, spewing plumes of up to five kilometres (3.11 miles) high, the country's seismology agency said, adding that evacuations were not yet recommended for residents in the area.
articles.title: Philippine volcano erupts, spewing plumes 5 km high

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy, Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: India's Election Commission said on Monday a record-breaking 642 million voters cast their ballots in the general election that concluded on June 1 and dismissed opposition concerns over how the votes would be counted.
articles.title: Indian election commission bats away concerns in record-breaking ballot count
